pullrequest.title: win_addpath.bat updated to work with gazebo 8

content.raw:
If I understand it correctly, partitions are a kind of namespaces (at least in DDS). So the only thing this might mess up is a situation when more gazebo servers would be running in the network on different machines. I'm not sure if this is a problem. Or, more precisely, I think it is not.

Of course it'd be wiser to fix the part that reads the username and sets it as the partition, so that it makes sure the string it passes as the partition is a valid partition identifier.
content.html:
If I understand it correctly, partitions are a kind of namespaces (at least in DDS). So the only thing this might mess up is a situation when more gazebo servers would be running in the network on different machines. I'm not sure if this is a problem. Or, more precisely, I think it is not.

Of course it'd be wiser to fix the part that reads the username and sets it as the partition, so that it makes sure the string it passes as the partition is a valid partition identifier.
